results.headline: Review: ‘The Ivory Game’ Follows the Fight to Protect Elephants
results.summary_short: This documentary, filmed in Africa and China, ruminates on the high stakes of poachers killing these animals for their tusks.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Ivory Game

results.headline: Review: ‘Ivory. A Crime Story,’ or the Plight of African Elephants
results.summary_short: This documentary from Sergey Yastrzhembsky treats the unpleasant subject of the elephants and ivory smuggling with the harshness it deserves.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ivory. A Crime Story

results.headline: Review: ‘Dog Eat Dog’ Is a Pulpy Tale With Nasty, Bumbling Crooks
results.summary_short: Nicolas Cage, Willem Dafoe and Christopher Matthew Cook star in this crime movie about some bad guys with hate in their hearts.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dog Eat Dog

results.headline: Review: The ‘Trolls’ Embark on a High-Haired Rescue Mission
results.summary_short: This DreamWorks film, voiced by stars like Anna Kendrick and Justin Timberlake, follows the adventures of a colorful group and their nemesis.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Trolls

results.headline: Review: ‘My Dead Boyfriend’ Shares a Life, After the Fact
results.summary_short: Heather Graham plays a woman in 1990s New York who begins to learn about her boyfriend only after he’s dead, in this film directed by Anthony Edwards.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Dead Boyfriend

results.headline: Review: In ‘Rainbow Time,’ Big Brother’s Watching (and Lusting)
results.summary_short: Linas Phillips’s film revolves around a developmentally disabled 40-year-old virgin — a bully who uses his condition to guilt others into excusing his bad behavior.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rainbow Time

results.headline: Review: ‘The Pickle Recipe’ Is a Sweet and Sour Caper
results.summary_short: In this comedy, a grandson in need of money plots with an uncle to steal the recipe for his grandmother’s famous pickles.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Pickle Recipe

results.headline: Review: In ‘Trash Fire,’ a Familiar Formula Fails
results.summary_short: Adrian Grenier stars in this black comedy from Richard Bates Jr.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Trash Fire

results.headline: Review: ‘Don’t Call Me Son’ Considers Identity and Fluidity
results.summary_short: In this Brazilian film from Anna Muylaert, an androgynous teenager discovers that the woman who raised him isn’t his biological mother.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Don’t Call Me Son

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Eagle Huntress,’ a Girl From Mongolia Soars
results.summary_short: A teenager from a nomadic family bucks gender norms by raising a bird and training it to hunt in this documentary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Eagle Huntress

results.headline: Review: ‘Hacksaw Ridge’ Has the Guts and the Glory. But Where’s the Gun?
results.summary_short: Mel Gibson’s new film tells the true story of Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to bear arms but still won the Medal of Honor in World War II.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hacksaw Ridge

results.headline: Review: Iggy Pop Bares All, and Nothing, in ‘Gimme Danger’
results.summary_short: Jim Jarmusch’s reverent documentary on Iggy Pop, a provocateur, is prim: It includes no retrospective scenes of drug use or the bandmates’ fights.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gimme Danger

results.headline: Review: ‘Into the Inferno,’ Staring Down the Terrors of Nature
results.summary_short: Werner Herzog’s documentary, a collaboration with a buoyant scientist, takes you to the precipice of volcanoes from Iceland to North Korea to Vanuatu.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Into the Inferno

results.headline: Review: In ‘Inferno,’ Breathlessly Globe-Trotting and Decoding to Save the World
results.summary_short: The symbologist played by Tom Hanks returns in another Dan Brown tale told at Ron Howard speed.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Inferno

results.headline: Review: ‘By Sidney Lumet’ Puts the Director in Front of the Camera
results.summary_short: The documentary began as a series of interviews shot in 2008 in which the director talks about his life and work.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of By Sidney Lumet

results.headline: Review: ‘A Billion Lives’ Claims There’s a Conspiracy Against Vaping
results.summary_short: Aaron Biebert’s documentary argues that e-cigarettes could help smokers quit, if only powerful forces weren’t trying to discredit them.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Billion Lives

results.headline: Review: In ‘Crosscurrent,’ a Melancholy Journey Along the Yangtze
results.summary_short: Yang Chao’s tale of a cargo boat owner’s trip from port to port is a meditation of China’s economic rebirth that pushes against the tide of prosperity.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Crosscurrent

results.headline: Review: ‘Finding Babel’ Retraces a Celebrated Grandfather’s Footsteps
results.summary_short: This documentary examines the life and work of the renowned Soviet writer Isaac Babel, who was executed by Stalin in 1940.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Finding Babel

results.headline: Review: ‘The Greasy Strangler’ Pairs Father and Son in Tours and Gore
results.summary_short: The two revel in Los Angeles disco history by day, and the dad stalks by night in this midnight-movie-esque work from Jim Hosking.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Greasy Strangler

results.headline: Review: In ‘Mr. Donkey,’ a Village School’s Ruse Farcically Backfires
results.summary_short: A parable about China’s past and perhaps its present underlies this mildly stagy and intermittently manic adaptation.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mr. Donkey
